title: About
text:
About This Project
My passion of basketball led me to analyze the Chicago Bulls’ Shooting Data. From the knowledge I obtained through Kane’s Data Science Bootcamp, a 6-week data science course, I was able to analyze and create graphs & models, coming up with interesting results.

title: Chicago Bulls Field Goal Percentage Prediction
text: The Chicago Bulls had a great season this year, qualifying for the NBA Play-In Tournament and eliminating the Toronto Raptors. The following data was pulled from FantasyPros, a website that provides fantasy sports data & content. Then, the data was filtered to look at the statistics of all the Chicago Bulls players. Finally, I created a Bayesian Prediction Model estimating the Field Goal Percentage of the Chicago Bulls Team. For the 2023-2024 NBA Season, the Chicago Bulls’ predicted average field goal percentage is 49.2%, represented by the dotted black line on the histogram.

title: models
text:
stan_glm
 family:       gaussian [identity]
 formula:      `FG%` ~ 1
 observations: 13
 predictors:   1
------
            Median MAD_SD
(Intercept) 0.5    0.0   

Auxiliary parameter(s):
      Median MAD_SD
sigma 0.1    0.0   

------
* For help interpreting the printed output see ?print.stanreg
* For info on the priors used see ?prior_summary.stanreg

title: players
text: The interactive scatterplot below shows the individual Field Goal Percentages (FG%) of Chicago Bulls players who have played at least 1000 minutes during the 2022-2023 NBA Season.

title: players
text:
Plot Summary
The scatterplot above shows that out of all the Chicago Bulls players that had played at least 1000 minutes, Nikola Vucevic had the highest FG%. I believe this result to be accurate as Nikola Vucevic has played a significant amount of minutes (2746 to be exact) during the 2022-2023 NBA Season. Also, Vucevic’s position (Center) requires him to take frequent layups, dunks, and mid-range shots, validating his FG%.

title: Sources
text:
I used an NBA 2022-2023 Player Statistics data set for this project, which I found through FantasyPros, a website that provides fantasy sports data & content.
Before creating my model, I had to clean the data first. I filtered the data set, analyzing only the NBA players from the Chicago Bulls. Upon examining this newly filtered data, I noticed a couple of outliers: some of the Chicago Bulls players hardly played any games in the 2022-2023 NBA season, due to injuries, 2-way contracts, etc.. By removing these outliers, the data would be more accurate. After removing the outliers, I created my fitted model, which I used to create the histogram.
